conclusion: Analyze the electric field and forces acting on the charged particle before and after the metal plate is removed.
Initially, the capacitor has a voltage V across the plates separated by a distance d.
The electric field E in the capacitor is given by E = V/d.
The metal plate with thickness l is placed on the lower plate, reducing the effective separation to d - l.
The electric field in the region above the metal plate remains E = V/d.
The electric force on the particle is F_e = qV/d.
Since the particle is stationary, the electric force balances the gravitational force: qV/d = mg.
Express the charge q as q = mgd/V.
When the metal plate is removed, the separation between the plates returns to d.
The electric field in the capacitor becomes E' = V/d.
The electric force on the particle now is F_e' = mg.
The net force on the particle is now F_net = mg - mg = 0.
The correct interpretation is that the particle will experience an acceleration due to the change in the electric field configuration.
The acceleration of the particle is a = g.
Thus, the acceleration of the particle is g.
